EXISTING STRUCTURES
────────────────────────
### Resource Depot & Smelting Facility at base position (x=-4.5, y=18.5)
Consists of the following entities:
- Wooden Chest at position (x=-4.5, y=18.5) serving as the central storage depot.
- Stone Furnace (iron smelting) at position (x=-3.0, y=19.0) used for converting iron ore.
- Stone Furnace (copper smelting) at position (x=-4.0, y=21.0) employed for copper plate production.
- Burner Inserter for copper extraction at position (x=0.5, y=21.5) with drop adjusted to (x=0.5, y=20.5).

### Automation Lab & Steam Power System (Integrated System)
Consists of the following entities:
- Lab at position (x=-7.5, y=18.5) configured for automation research.
- Boiler at position (x=-5.5, y=24.0) (currently flagged with fuel issues).
- Generator (Steam Engine) at position (x=-0.5, y=24.5) reporting warnings regarding power network, input liquid, and fluid presence.
- Offshore Pump at position (x=-7.5, y=25.5) operating normally.
- Electricity Group comprising small electric poles at positions (x=-0.5, y=11.5), (x=-7.5, y=15.5), (x=-4.5, y=15.5), (x=3.5, y=19.5) and (x=1.5, y=22.5).
- Pipe Groups forming the fluid network:
   • PipeGroup at position (x=-10.5, y=16.5) – EMPTY.
   • PipeGroup at position (x=-12.5, y=18.5) – EMPTY.
   • PipeGroup at position (x=-8.5, y=20.5) – FULL_OUTPUT (fluid: water).
   • PipeGroup at position (x=-2.5, y=21.5) – EMPTY.

### Copper Cable Factory at position (x=1.5, y=19.5)
Consists of the following entities:
- Assembling Machine at position (x=1.5, y=19.5) running the copper-cable recipe.
- Preexisting Burner Inserter at position (x=1.5, y=17.5).
- Input Chest at position (x=2.5, y=17.5) designated for receiving copper plates.
- Output Chest at position (x=1.5, y=21.5) for dispatching copper-cable.
- Dedicated Copper Buffer Chest at position (x=-5.5, y=21.5) holding copper plates.
- Dedicated Transport Belt Segment at position (x=0.5, y=17.5) for connecting production outputs.
- New Burner Inserter at position (x=2.5, y=16.5) placed using direction UP with a pickup coordinate at (x=2.5, y=17.5).
- New Burner Inserter at position (x=3.5, y=17.5) placed using direction RIGHT with a pickup at (x=2.5, y=17.5) and drop at (x=4.5, y=17.5).

### Copper Extraction System (adjacent to the copper smelting furnace)
Consists of the following entities:
- Extraction Burner Inserter at position (x=-3.5, y=23.5) with pickup at (x=-3.5, y=22.5) and drop at (x=-3.5, y=24.5).
- Copper Buffer Chest at position (x=-3.5, y=26.5).
- Chest Extraction Burner Inserter at position (x=-3.5, y=27.5) with pickup at (x=-3.5, y=26.5) and drop at (x=-3.5, y=28.5).
(Note: Multi‐segment belt connections linking this extraction system remain uncompleted despite multiple attempts.)

### Extraction Belt Depot at position (x=3.5, y=15.5)
Consists of the following entities:
- Wooden Chest at position (x=3.5, y=15.5) serving as the belt depot.
- Dedicated Transport Belt Segment at position (x=4.5, y=15.5) to serve as the endpoint for copper plate conveyance.
- Depot Burner Inserter at position (x=3.5, y=14.5) placed using direction UP; it has a pickup coordinate at (x=3.5, y=15.5) and a drop coordinate at (x=3.5, y=13.5).
(Note: Multiple attempts to connect a continuous, multi‐segment transport belt from the extraction system to the depot have repeatedly failed due to targeting and path configuration issues.)

ERROR TIPS
────────────────────────
• Belt Connection Target Validation:
  - Always ensure that transport belts do not target a Prototype.SteamEngine directly. Use an intermediary inserter to properly feed items into powered entities.

• Belt Connection Path Configuration:
  - Validate that intermediate waypoint definitions yield a monotonic, normalisable path. Adjust offsets and alignment to avoid “Not a valid path to normalise” errors.

• Consistent Connection Strategy:
  - When multiple belt connection attempts fail, standardise the approach by checking both target entity type and ensuring the intermediate waypoints circumvent interference from nearby structures (e.g. the steam engine group).
